technical_discussions.title: fix: pass ANTHROPIC_API_KEY to enhancement step
technical_discussions.body_excerpt:
## Summary
- Add `env: ANTHROPIC_API_KEY` to the Claude AI Content Enhancement step — the secret exists in the repo but wasn't exposed to the step
- Wrap script call with `set +e` / `set -e` so `process.exit(1)` from `claude-enhancer.js` doesn't bypass the step's "continuing with existing content" e...

technical_discussions.title: fix: prevent test runner deserialization race in Node 20
technical_discussions.body_excerpt:
## Summary
- Add `--test-concurrency=1` to the npm test script to run test files sequentially
- Fixes `Unable to deserialize cloned data due to invalid or unsupported version` error in CI (Node v20.20.0)
- This is a known Node 20 test runner IPC race condition when running multiple test files concur...

technical_discussions.title: fix: repair CI/CD pipelines and replace deprecated deployment
technical_discussions.body_excerpt:
## Summary
- Fix `cd ../...` typo in cv-enhancement.yml (hard blocker — caused shell error every run)
- Reorder `npm install` to run after `actions/setup-node@v4` in both workflows (was using system Node instead of v20)
- Replace deprecated `peaceiris/actions-gh-pages@v3` (Node 16) with direct file ...

technical_discussions.title: Build size tracking and budget
technical_discussions.body_excerpt: Add a CI step that reports total dist/ size and per-page bundle sizes. Set a budget (e.g. total < 50MB, any single page < 200KB HTML). Track over time to catch regressions. Output as CI annotation or PR comment.

technical_discussions.title: Automated dependency audit in CI
technical_discussions.body_excerpt: Add a CI step running npm audit with severity threshold (critical/high = fail, moderate = warn). Run weekly via scheduled workflow and on PRs. Pin action versions for security. Report results as PR comment or CI annotation.

technical_discussions.title: Custom 404 page with analytics tracking
technical_discussions.body_excerpt: Enhance the existing 404 page (if any) or create src/pages/404.astro with: helpful messaging, search link, popular page links, and a GA4 event that logs the attempted URL. Helps identify broken inbound links.

technical_discussions.title: Image optimization enforcement in CI
technical_discussions.body_excerpt: Add a CI step that checks images in public/ are under size thresholds (e.g. PNG < 500KB, JPG < 300KB). Warn on oversized images. Optionally auto-compress with sharp/squoosh in a pre-commit hook. Prevents accidentally committing unoptimized images.

technical_discussions.title: Link checker for internal and external links
technical_discussions.body_excerpt: Add a post-build link check using a lightweight tool (lychee or similar). Check all internal links resolve to built pages. Check external links return 2xx. Run in CI with allowlist for known-flaky external URLs. Report broken links as CI failure.

technical_discussions.title: Content validation script
technical_discussions.body_excerpt: Create scripts/validate-content.sh that checks all content collections for: required frontmatter fields present, valid date formats, tags array non-empty, URLs well-formed, image paths resolve to existing files, no draft posts accidentally published. Run as CI check.

technical_discussions.title: Responsive image srcset for hero and gallery images
technical_discussions.body_excerpt: Add srcset and sizes attributes to hero images in blog/project detail pages and gallery cover images. Generate multiple image widths (400, 800, 1200) at build time. Allows browsers to load appropriately sized images for the viewport.

technical_discussions.title: Upgrade dns-prefetch to preconnect for critical origins
technical_discussions.body_excerpt: Upgrade dns-prefetch hints in SEOHead.astro to preconnect for origins used on initial page load (googletagmanager.com if consent given). Keep dns-prefetch as fallback for older browsers. Add crossorigin attribute where needed.

technical_discussions.title: Scroll-driven animations for content sections
technical_discussions.body_excerpt: Add subtle scroll-triggered animations using CSS scroll-driven animations API (no JS library). Apply fade-in-up to blog post cards, project cards, and gallery items. Use @supports for progressive enhancement — no animation on unsupported browsers.

technical_discussions.title: Astro View Transitions
technical_discussions.body_excerpt: Add Astro View Transitions API for smooth page-to-page navigation. Add ViewTransitions component to BaseLayout.astro head. Add transition:name directives to key elements (header, main content, footer). Handle theme persistence across transitions.

technical_discussions.title: Image blur-up LQIP placeholders
technical_discussions.body_excerpt: Generate low-quality image placeholders (LQIP) at build time for hero images and gallery covers. Display a blurred placeholder while the full image loads, then crossfade. Use a build script to generate tiny (20px wide) base64-encoded thumbnails.

technical_discussions.title: WebP/AVIF image conversion pipeline
technical_discussions.body_excerpt: Create a build script that converts PNG/JPG images in public/ to WebP (and optionally AVIF) with appropriate quality settings. Add <picture> element support with WebP source sets and PNG/JPG fallbacks. Target: OG images, gallery covers, hero images.

technical_discussions.title: WebSite JSON-LD with SearchAction on homepage
technical_discussions.body_excerpt:

- @type WebSite
- name, url, description
- potentialAction: SearchAction pointing to /search/?q={search_term_string}

This enables Google's sitelinks search box.

- Add publisher as Organization (name, url, logo)
- Add sameAs array with social profile URLs (GitHub, LinkedIn)
- Add mainEntityOfPage with @id

This provides a richer base schema that all pages inherit.

technical_discussions.title: Project page JSON-LD: enrich existing SoftwareApplication schema
technical_discussions.body_excerpt:

**Add:** applicationCategory, operatingSystem (if applicable), codeRepository (repo URL), offers (free), dateModified. Ensure the existing schema includes all available frontmatter fields.

technical_discussions.title: Gallery collection JSON-LD: ImageGallery schema
technical_discussions.body_excerpt:

**Include:** @type ImageGallery, name, description, datePublished, image (array of ImageObject entries from the collection's images).

Individual image pages (`[collection]/[image].astro`) should get Imag...

technical_discussions.title: Audio episode JSON-LD: PodcastEpisode / AudioObject schema
technical_discussions.body_excerpt:
Add JSON-LD structured data to audio detail pages (`src/pages/audio/[...slug].astro`).

**Include:** @type PodcastEpisode (or AudioObject), name, description, datePublished, duration, contentUrl (audioUrl), associatedMedia, partOfSeries.

This enables rich results for podcast episodes in search.

technical_discussions.title: Blog post JSON-LD: Article schema with author and publisher
technical_discussions.body_excerpt:
Add JSON-LD Article structured data to blog detail pages (`src/pages/blog/[...slug].astro`).

**Include:** @type Article, headline, datePublished, dateModified (if updatedDate), author (Person), publisher (Organization), image, description, mainEntityOfPage.

SEOHead already outputs a basic Article ...

technical_discussions.title: Project index: show date on cards
technical_discussions.body_excerpt: Blog index shows date + reading time per card. Audio index shows date + duration. Project index cards show title, description, status, and tags — but no date. Add date display to project cards for visual consistency.

technical_discussions.title: Gallery collection tags: convert spans to links
technical_discussions.body_excerpt: Gallery collection detail page tags are static `<span>` elements. Blog, project, and audio pages use `<a>` tags linking to tag pages. Convert gallery collection tags to `<a href='/gallery/tag/{tag}/'>` for consistency and discoverability.

technical_discussions.title: Prev/next navigation on gallery collection pages
technical_discussions.body_excerpt: Blog, project, and audio detail pages have chronological prev/next navigation. Gallery collection pages only have 'All collections' back link. Add prev/next collection nav matching the pattern used elsewhere.

technical_discussions.title: ShareButton on gallery collection and image pages
technical_discussions.body_excerpt: Blog, project, and audio detail pages all have ShareButton. Gallery collection pages and individual image pages don't. Add ShareButton to both gallery/[...slug].astro and gallery/[collection]/[image].astro for consistency.

technical_discussions.title: Audio transcript display polish
technical_discussions.body_excerpt: Transcripts are in a plain details/summary with raw whitespace. Improve with: word count in summary label, copy-to-clipboard button on the transcript content. Makes transcripts feel polished rather than raw dumps.

technical_discussions.title: Project series support
technical_discussions.body_excerpt: Blog has series + seriesOrder for multi-part content. Projects don't, but related sequences exist (multi-agent systems, failure analysis). Add series/seriesOrder to project schema and series navigation UI on project detail pages (same pattern as blog).

technical_discussions.title: NotebookAssets support on audio episode pages
technical_discussions.body_excerpt: Audio episodes are generated by NotebookLM but can't display associated assets (quiz, flashcards, mindmap, etc). Blog and project pages already use NotebookAssets component. Add notebookAssets fields to audio schema in content.config.ts and render NotebookAssets on audio/[...slug].astro before Relat...

technical_discussions.title: Blog reading position indicator
technical_discussions.body_excerpt: Blog posts have a reading progress bar (width-based) but no text indicator. Add a small 'X min remaining' label that updates as the reader scrolls. Position near the progress bar or as a floating label. Disappears when article is fully read.

technical_discussions.title: Colophon: dependency versions and build stats
technical_discussions.body_excerpt: Enhance the colophon with: full dependency list from package.json (name + version), total build output size, number of static pages generated. Makes the transparency section more useful for technical visitors.

technical_discussions.title: Project status legend on index page
technical_discussions.body_excerpt: Project index has color-coded status badges (green=active, copper=complete, gray=archived, purple=experiment) but no legend explaining what each means. Add a small collapsible or tooltip-based legend near the status filter buttons.

technical_discussions.title: Footer: expand navigation links
technical_discussions.body_excerpt: Footer currently has: GitHub, LinkedIn, Contact, RSS, Now, Colophon. Missing useful links: About, Search, Analytics, Projects, Blog. Reorganize into two rows or grouped columns for better navigation. Add a subtle back-to-top link.

technical_discussions.title: Homepage hero: add CTA buttons
technical_discussions.body_excerpt: The homepage hero has text but no clear call-to-action buttons. Add 2 CTA buttons below the intro paragraph: 'View Projects' (primary, accent-styled) and 'Read Blog' (secondary, border-styled). Helps first-time visitors navigate immediately.

technical_discussions.title: Back-to-top button for long pages
technical_discussions.body_excerpt: Add a floating back-to-top button that appears when the user scrolls past the first viewport. Shows on blog posts, project detail pages, and other long-form content. Smooth scroll to top on click. Positioned bottom-right, styled with site's border/surface tokens.

technical_discussions.title: Dynamic OG images for blog posts
technical_discussions.body_excerpt: The site uses a single og-default.svg for all pages. Generate per-post OG images at build time using @vercel/og or a canvas-based approach — render title, date, and tags on a branded template matching the site's dark palette. Significantly improves social media link previews.

technical_discussions.title: About page: journey timeline
technical_discussions.body_excerpt: Add a compact timeline between the intro and 'What I'm Working On' showing 3-4 career milestones: environmental advocacy → government → infrastructure → AI safety. Shows the systems-thinking thread rather than just asserting it. Use a simple vertical timeline component.

technical_discussions.title: Contact page: add context section
technical_discussions.body_excerpt: The contact page has mechanics (email, phone, social) but no context about why someone might reach out. Add a brief section above the contact details mentioning: research collaboration, AI safety discussions, speaking/advisory, or job opportunities. Matches the /now and /about messaging.

technical_discussions.title: Project status color-coding on index page
technical_discussions.body_excerpt: Status labels on the project index (active, complete, archived, experiment) are visually identical. Add semantic color-coding: active=green, complete=accent, archived=muted, experiment=purple. Apply to both the filter buttons and the status badges on cards.

technical_discussions.title: Blog post series support
technical_discussions.body_excerpt: Add optional `series` (string) and `seriesOrder` (number) fields to the blog schema. When a post belongs to a series, render series navigation showing all posts in that series with the current one highlighted. Enables multi-part content like 'AI Safety Fundamentals' parts 1-3.

technical_discussions.title: Share button component for content pages
technical_discussions.body_excerpt: Add a share component to blog posts, project pages, and audio pages. Use the Web Share API where available (mobile), with fallback copy-to-clipboard for desktop. Include Twitter/X, LinkedIn, and email share links. Position after the title metadata area.

technical_discussions.title: Unified content stats on /now page
technical_discussions.body_excerpt: The /now page describes current focus but doesn't surface site-wide content metrics. Add a compact stats section showing total counts (posts, projects, galleries, audio episodes, total words written) calculated at build time. Gives visitors a quick sense of the site's depth.

technical_discussions.title: Blog index: tag filter navigation bar
technical_discussions.body_excerpt: Blog index page doesn't have a tag filter bar (only the /blog/tag/[tag] pages do). Add a tag navigation bar at the top of the blog index, matching the pattern used on tag pages. This makes filtering discoverable without needing to visit a tag page first.

technical_discussions.title: Homepage: add gallery and audio sections
technical_discussions.body_excerpt: Homepage shows Featured Work and Recent Writing but doesn't showcase gallery or audio content. Add a gallery preview (2-3 collections with cover images) and an audio preview (latest 2-3 episodes) to give a complete picture of site content.

bin/px-frigate-stream:8 calls 'python' which is not available outside the venv. Test test_px_frigate_stream_dry_run fails with exit code 127 (command not found).

## Fix
Change invocation to 'python3' or use the venv python path.

technical_discussions.body_excerpt:
## Bug

time.py:8 - datetime.datetime.utcnow() is deprecated in Python 3.12+ and returns a naive datetime despite the appended 'Z' suffix. Causes 105 deprecation warnings in test suite.

## Fix
Replace with datetime.datetime.now(datetime.UTC).replace(microsecond=0).isoformat() + 'Z' or use time...

boot-health:23 - When vcgencmd returns 'unavailable', THROTTLED_RAW is 'unavailable'. The arithmetic expansion 16#unavailable silently falls back to 0 via || THROTTLED_DEC=0, making it appear no throttle flags are set.

technical_discussions.title: MODERATE: ensure_session creates STATE_DIR but not parent dir of custom PX_SESSION_PATH
technical_discussions.body_excerpt:

state.py:46-48 - ensure_session() creates STATE_DIR but if PX_SESSION_PATH points to a file in a non-existent directory, the write fails with FileNotFoundError.

## Fix
Create the parent directory of session_path() instead of (or in addition to) STATE_DIR.

voice_loop.py:319-326 - Every idle poll (waiting for listening=true in voice mode) increments the turn counter. With max_turns=50 and PX_LISTEN_IDLE_SLEEP=0.5, the loop exhausts all turns in 25 seconds and exits silently without ever processing a command.

Only count turns where ...

px-diagnostics:53 - announce() passes os.environ.get('PX_DRY', '0') to tool-voice, defaulting to live audio even when PX_DRY is unset in the environment. All other tool wrappers default to dry (PX_DRY=1) when unset.

Collect lines into a buffer and attempt to parse multi-line JSON objects, or join all ...

## Bug

tool-stop:25-34 - In dry-run mode, tool-stop returns {"status": "ok", "dry": true} without stopping motors. A session that transitions from dry to live without clearing PX_DRY will silently fail to halt. The ok status gives false assurance.

state.py:89-90 - When update_session() encounters JSONDecodeError, it silently resets to default_state() and applies new fields on top of wiped state. No log entry, no exception. Callers have no way to know their update was applied to a blank state rather than actual prior state.

When invoked from systemd or cron (CWD=/), all tools fail with FileNotFoundError, silently caught by bare except Exception, returning pay...

technical_discussions.title: 📊 Add System Health Monitoring & API Checks
technical_discussions.body_excerpt:
## Objective
Implement comprehensive health monitoring for all system components with graceful degradation when services unavailable.

## Components to Monitor

development_philosophy.message: Fix DST bug in booking widget timezone offset
development_philosophy.full_message:
Fix DST bug in booking widget timezone offset

Hardcoded +11:00 (AEDT) was wrong during AEST months (Apr–Oct, UTC+10).
Now derives the correct offset for the slot date using Intl.DateTimeFormat
with Australia/Hobart timezone, which handles DST transitions automatically.
Label updated to 'Hobart time (AEST/AEDT)' — accurate year-round.

Closes #163

- heroImage added to 7 blog posts (OG images)

- Footer updated with combined RSS and podcast feed links
- noindex on utility pages (search, analytics, colophon)

development_philosophy.full_message:
Add blog post: Hyperfocus and 3,000 Plush Toys

Technical deep-dive on building the Squishmallowdex — scraping,

development_philosophy.full_message:
🔧 Fix: Cleanup codebase quality and test infrastructure (#154)

* 🔧 Fix: Cleanup codebase quality and test infrastructure

## 🎯 Fixes Applied

### ✅ Security & Dependencies
- Fixed 5 security vulnerabilities via npm audit fix
- Updated package-lock.json with secure dependency versions
- Remaining 4 low-severity vulnerabilities in dev dependencies only

### ✅ Code Quality
- Fixed 2 Playwright linting warnings (replaced waitForSelector with modern locator patterns)
- All ESLint checks now passing with 0 errors, 0 warnings
- Code formatting verified with Prettier (100% compliant)

### ✅ Test Infrastructure
- Fixed AI service test mocks (shouldCachePrompt boolean return, tokensPerRequest calculation)
- Fixed voice commands test mock (added missing addCommandLine method)
- Improved Playwright test patterns for better reliability
- Installed Playwright browsers for E2E testing

## 📊 Quality Metrics
- **Linting**: ✅ Clean (0 errors, 0 warnings)
- **Formatting**: ✅ Clean (100% Prettier compliant)
- **Security**: ✅ Improved (9 → 4 low-severity vulnerabilities)
- **Test Coverage**: 198/209 unit tests passing (95%)

## 🔍 Technical Details

### Test Fixes
1. tests/e2e/*.spec.js: Updated to use expect(locator).toBeVisible() instead of deprecated waitForSelector()
2. tests/unit/ai-service.test.js: Fixed mock return values for shouldCachePrompt() and added tokensPerRequest calculation
3. tests/unit/voice-commands.test.js: Added addCommandLine to mock terminal UI

### Known Remaining Issues
- Some unit test mocks need refinement (voice-commands toggle tests, script-engine export tests)
- E2E tests require web server configuration (webServer commented out in playwright.config.cjs)
- These appear to be test implementation issues, not actual application bugs

## ✨ Impact
Cleaned up degraded codebase quality from week-long performance issues. Core application code is clean and follows best practices. Linting and formatting are perfect. Security posture improved.

- ✅ All 4 E2E tests passing (100%)

### Configuration Details
- Server: Python HTTP server on port 8081
- Timeout: 120s for server startup

The remaining unit test failures are in the test mocks themselves (voice-commands and script-engine tests have Jest mocking setup issues), not in the actual application code.

development_philosophy.message: 📊 Comprehensive Repository Review - Security, Testing, and Architecture Analysis (#155)
development_philosophy.full_message:
📊 Comprehensive Repository Review - Security, Testing, and Architecture Analysis (#155)

## Executive Summary
Complete deep-dive analysis of adrianwedd repository covering security, code health, testing, documentation, and technical debt.

## Key Findings
- **Security:** 7 critical vulnerabilities identified (voice command injection, XSS, auth issues)
- **Test Coverage:** 15-20% actual (Jest not installed, tautological tests)
- **Code Quality:** 21,392 lines analyzed - modern ES6+ with modular architecture
- **Documentation:** Outdated references (CLAUDE.md), missing setup guide
- **Technical Debt:** 4,645 lines of legacy code (28% of codebase)

## Analysis Scope
✅ Code Health - Dependencies, dead code, security issues
✅ Documentation Gaps - Completeness and accuracy assessment
✅ Technical Debt - Refactoring needs and patterns
✅ Critical Paths - AI service, voice interface, GitHub integration
✅ Test Quality - Coverage analysis and effectiveness
✅ Git Archaeology - Commit patterns and secret scanning
✅ GitHub Workflows - 11 workflows analyzed for security/efficiency

## Priority Actions
🔴 CRITICAL:
- Fix voice command injection vulnerability
- Implement AI service authentication
- Repair test infrastructure (install Jest)
- Address 3 high-severity npm vulnerabilities

🟡 HIGH:
- XSS protection with DOMPurify
- Memory leak fixes (uncleared intervals)
- Test core modules (0% coverage)
- Update architecture documentation

🟢 MEDIUM:
- Environment variable validation
- LocalStorage quota handling
- Error boundary implementation
- Create .env.example file

## What's Good
✅ Excellent modular architecture (successful monolith→modules migration)
✅ Sophisticated AI prompt caching
✅ Modern JavaScript patterns throughout
✅ Comprehensive accessibility implementation
✅ No hardcoded secrets (clean security posture)
✅ Innovative voice interface and music synthesis
✅ Best-in-class GitHub task management (1,229 test lines!)

## Recommendations
30-day plan to achieve production-ready status:
- Week 1: Critical security hardening
- Week 2: Test infrastructure and core coverage
- Week 3: Documentation and cleanup
- Week 4: Polish and validation

**Overall Health:** 6.5/10 → Potential 9/10 with recommended fixes

---

> Generated via comprehensive multi-agent analysis
> Completed with Claude Code - https://claude.ai/code

development_philosophy.message: Fix 14 QA issues across library, bin scripts, and tests
development_philosophy.full_message:
Fix 14 QA issues across library, bin scripts, and tests

Library (src/pxh/):
- state.py: ensure_session now creates parent dir of PX_SESSION_PATH, not
  just STATE_DIR, so custom session paths in new dirs work (closes #10)
- state.py: log a structured event when session.json is corrupt and reset
  to default, so callers are no longer silently surprised (closes #3)
- time.py: replace deprecated datetime.utcnow() with
  datetime.now(timezone.utc); eliminates 105 DeprecationWarnings on
  Python 3.12+ (closes #12)
- voice_loop.py: fix PX_DRY env override — operator's exported PX_DRY=1
  was silently overwritten to "0" when dry_mode=False (closes #1)
- voice_loop.py: extract_action now handles multi-line pretty-printed JSON
  from model (full-output parse before line-by-line fallback) (closes #6)
- voice_loop.py: idle voice polls no longer consume max_turns; turn counter
  only increments when real input is captured (closes #9)

Bin scripts:
- run-voice-loop: replace non-existent model gpt-5-codex with
  gpt-4.1-mini, matching voice_loop.py default (closes #4)
- tool-stop: add warning field to dry-run payload to distinguish no-op
  from real halt (closes #5)
- px-diagnostics: resolve all child tool paths against PROJECT_ROOT so
  the script works when CWD != project root (closes #2)
- px-diagnostics: announce() defaults PX_DRY to "1" (dry) not "0",
  matching the convention of all other tool wrappers (closes #7)
- px-diagnostics: rc=2 from motion tools (confirm_motion_allowed gate)
  is now a warn with actionable message, not a hard error (closes #14)
- boot-health: fix structurally invalid JSON from log() — introduce
  log_json helper that emits proper JSONL (closes #8)
- boot-health: detect "unavailable" throttle reading explicitly instead
  of silently treating it as 0/no-flags (closes #11)
- px-frigate-stream: call python3 not python (closes #13)

Tests:
- test_routines.py: test_px_frigate_stream_dry_run now uses shared run()
  helper so it inherits the venv environment; was failing with exit 127

Co-Authored-By: Claude Sonnet 4.6 <noreply@anthropic.com>

development_philosophy.message: Fix deadlock in update_session and dry-mode audio in tool-voice
development_philosophy.full_message:
Fix deadlock in update_session and dry-mode audio in tool-voice

- state.py: update_session called ensure_session() while holding the
  FileLock, causing a deadlock since FileLock is not reentrant. Fix by
  calling ensure_session() before acquiring the lock.
- tool-voice: audio (espeak/aplay) was always executed regardless of
  PX_DRY, causing test hangs. Skip audio when dry_mode is True.
- px-diagnostics: announce() and speaker/summary voice calls now respect
  dry_mode via PX_DRY env var instead of hardcoding PX_DRY=0.
- All 17 tests now pass in ~10s.

Co-Authored-By: Claude Sonnet 4.6 <noreply@anthropic.com>

development_philosophy.message: Harden tooling: FileLock, threaded watchdog, sudo env passthrough, test isolation
development_philosophy.full_message:
Harden tooling: FileLock, threaded watchdog, sudo env passthrough, test isolation

- Replace sudo -E with sudo env PYTHONPATH= in all tool wrappers (circle,
  figure8, status, stop) for safer environment handling
- Add FileLock to all log writes and session state reads/writes in pxh library
- Refactor voice_loop watchdog from session.json polling to background thread
  with queue.Queue heartbeats — more reliable under load
- Fix JSON action parsing bug in voice_loop (startswith/endswith {} -> {/})
- Make PX_VOICE_DEVICE optional in tool-voice; aplay uses default if unset
- Wrap camera and mic temp file cleanup in finally blocks in px-diagnostics
- Refactor tests to use isolated_project fixture with per-test tmp dirs
- Add boot-health systemd script for power/throttle diagnostics and motor reset
- Add transcribe-whatever, transcribe-whisper helpers
- Add requirements.txt and docs/ALL_DOCS_REVIEW.md

development_philosophy.message: Implement NotebookLM export automation (Phase 1)
development_philosophy.full_message:
Implement NotebookLM export automation (Phase 1)

This commit implements Phase 1 of the NotebookLM automation project:
exporting notebooks with all sources, notes, and studio artifacts.

Components:
- export-notebook.sh: Export single notebook by ID or name
- export-all.sh: Batch export all notebooks with progress tracking
- Design document with architecture and implementation plan
- External AI reviews (Gemini, Codex) with risk analysis

Features:
- Export sources with content extraction
- Export notes and metadata
- Download all studio artifacts by type:
  * Audio overviews (MP3)
  * Video overviews (MP4)
  * Reports (Markdown)
  * Slide decks (PDF)
  * Infographics (PNG)
  * Mind maps (JSON)
  * Quizzes, flashcards, data tables (JSON/CSV)
- Slug-based directory naming with collision handling
- Skip already-exported notebooks (incremental mode)
- Structured export format with index files

Known limitations:
- Chat history export not supported (NotebookLM API limitation)
- Requires authenticated notebooklm-mcp-cli
- Uses reverse-engineered RPCs (fragile to API changes)

Tested on 80 notebooks, verified with multiple exports.

Co-Authored-By: Claude Sonnet 4.5 <noreply@anthropic.com>
